description: This 1994 mini-series is the english translation of a manga originally titled Street Fighter II: Ryu. Written and drawn by world renow artist Masaomi Kanzkie it included the first twelve fighters in the series. Published by Tokuma Comics, which was the U.S. imprint of Tokuma Shoten, this mini is one of the first titles of the series¬†to be translated¬†into english and boasts the first apperance of Ryu and Ken's Sensei Gouken. In order to cater for the US market some of the panels have been rearanged from the manga so that the comic could be read in a western left-to-right format.
name: Street Fighter II

description:
Proper Japanese Title: Êñ∞‰∏ñÁ¥Ä„Ç®„É¥„Ç°„É≥„Ç≤„É™„Ç™„É≥ (Shin Seiki Evangerion)

A manga adaptation of GAINAX's Evangelion series, which started just prior to it's television run and is still ongoing as of 2011. For the most part it follows the plotline of the anime closely, however Sadamoto has adapted the plot where he sees fit to give this alternate retelling of the series its own feel. The main characters are Shinji Ikari, Rei Ayanami and Asuka Soryu who are pitted to do battle against Lovecraftian horrors known as the Angels.

Translated into English as Neon Genesis Evangelion by Viz.
name: Neon Genesis Evangelion

description:
In NEOZOIC, a debut title from publisher Red 5 Comics, there‚Äôs nothing special about an 80-foot-long brachiosaurus lumbering past a group of human travelers. It‚Äôs been going on for millions of years.

However, if those same humans hear the blood-thirty roars of a T-Rex, then it‚Äôs time to call the professional super-hunters of the Predator Defense League. Armed only with swords, arrows, warrior cunning, ruthless precision and a lifetime of training, these exceptionally skilled athletes keep the citizens of the walled city of Monanti from becoming a dinosaur‚Äôs breakfast.

NEOZOIC is the creation of Lucasfilm-veteran Paul Ens, writer of the fan-favorite ‚ÄúStar Wars: Evasive Action‚Äù series. Like most boys, at an early age Ens was inspired by dinosaurs. ‚ÄúAnd like most comic writers,‚Äù he adds, ‚Äúmy childhood influences never left me. Dinosaurs thrilled me first from the pages of science books, then in entertainment like Land of the Lost, Godzilla and Jurassic Park.‚Äù

Unlike most dinosaur-themed fiction, where ill-prepared and unsuspecting modern-day humans are thrust together with pre-historic beasts through some contortion in time, NEOZOIC imagines an Earth where the dinosaurs escaped extinction altogether. As a result, the entire history of the human race unfolded side-by-side with the giant beasts, leading to a society greatly different than the one we know today.

While the kinetic pencils of J. Korim and the rich colors of Jessie Lam deliver on the promise of epic evenly-matched human / dino battles like never seen before, the complex heart of NEOZOIC is in its ensemble cast of characters.

‚ÄúJust as the war with cylons is merely a backdrop for multi-textured drama in Battlestar Galactica,‚Äù Ens explains, ‚Äúthe epic struggles in NEOZOIC are human conflicts stemming from the different approaches to survival from such formidable natural predators.‚Äù
name: Neozoic

description:
After her mother dies in a car accident, Tohru Honda finds herself alone and living in a tent.

But everything changes when she moves in with herclassmate Yuki Sohma and his family. Not too long into living with the Sohma‚Äôs,Tohru finds out the family secret: they are all possessed by the signs of the Chinese zodiac: when any member is ill, weak, agitated or hugged by a member of the opposite sex, they turn into their specific zodiac animal!

Tohru sets out to break the family curse but it isn‚Äôt easy, first she must encounter the more spiteful zodiac spirits...

English translation of the Japanese manga Fruits Basket.

Collected Editions

description: Alex Robinson, "the master of true-to-life relationship drama" (Library Journal), has created another tour de force. Tricked follows the lives of six people -- a reclusive rock legend, a heartbroken waitress, a counterfeiter, an obsessive crank, a lost daughter, and a frustrated lover -- whose lives are unconnected until an act of violence brings them spiraling in on each other. Combining intriguing characters with a story structure that is both complex and innovative, Tricked is not to be missed.
name: Tricked

description:
A Decimation tie-in miniseries.

When the fate of the world hangs in the balance, how much do you trust someone who hides behind a garish costume, has freakish super-powers, or keeps their real identity a secret ? That was the question posed by the government's Office Of National Emergency. Their answer? Create their own super-team, a team the O.N.E. agency can control. And so, the Sentinel Squad program was initiated, where the 80-foot-tall mutant-hunting robots known as the Sentinels would be redesigned and rebuilt for this explicit purpose. But this time around, the Sentinels would be equipped with human pilots.

Collected in Sentinel Squad O*N*E: Tin-Can Heroes.
name: Sentinel Squad O*N*E

description:
The monthly US comic book formatted left-to-right manga from Dark Horse comics. Printed between 1994 & 2004, each month was a 'chapter' of the original manga stories.

Early chapters were omitted in the original print run, as it was felt that Western audiences wouldn't understand cultural situations and references. However, as this omission caused years of complaints from fans, the 'missing chapters' were later included in Dark Horse's manga anthology title, Super Manga Blast!. They were subsequently included (in the correct reading order) in the newer trade paperback reprints of the Oh My Goddess series.

Although the monthly comic book format of the series was cancelled ending in 2004, the series was still ongoing in Japan. As such, Dark Horse have continued to publish the stories in the collected trade paperback/tankoban format instead.
name: Oh My Goddess!

description: A collection of Tim Quinn and Dicky Howett's humorous strips based on TV show Doctor Who and its characters. The two cartoonists regularly contributed a three panel comic strip, Doctor Who?, which was printed in Doctor Who Magazine. This was the second volume of all-new material they had produced, following 1987's The Doctor Who Fun Book, which had been published by Target Books, the same company that (at this time) printed novelisations of the Doctor Who TV stories.
name: Doctor Who: It's Bigger on the Inside!

description:
¬†A hero of World War I, Captain Albright took on the mission of capturing the nefarious Ivan Shark before Shark could launch a midnight strike on the Allies. Amazed at his success, his commanders swore him in as secret agent and gave him the name ‚ÄúCaptain Midnight.‚Äù After the war, he became a crime-fighter and inventor (in the comics version, at least), but was pulled back to action when World War II broke out.

The Captain‚Äôs had amazing flying skill, which allowed him to outmaneuver even the most determined Nazi fighter pilot and perform incredible landings on impossible terrain. He also had a ‚Äúgliderchute‚Äù which gave him gliding ability, and a ‚ÄúDoom Beam Torch‚Äù which generated heat rays. And, like any self-respecting hero of the age, he had a pair of wards, Chuck Ramsey and Joyce Ryan, as well as a legion of faithful ‚ÄúFlight Patrol‚Äù listeners who tuned into his radio adventures, decoder rings at the ready.

Series changes to Sweethearts after #67
name: Captain Midnight
